metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18511 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-origin images can be read from a canvas element in violation of the same-origin policy using the transferFromImageBitmap method. *Note: This only affects Firefox 65. Previous versions are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
